translations.translation: An error has occurred while waiting for operation: {{message}}
An error has occurred while getting main offer details: {{message}}
An error occurred while retrieving the log details: {message}

Dashboards are graphical representations of your logs. Thanks to the different modules (curves, pie charts, counters, statistics ...), you get a synthetic view of your data. How many errors have occurred in the last 24 hours? Are they up or down? What is the most visited page today? How many customers this month? So much information immediately accessible. Having different tables allows you to display the data according to specific contexts and provides a greater readability of the information.
Are you sure you want to delete dashboard: {{dashboardName}} ?
You are currently subscribed to Basic offer and should upgrade to PRO in order to be able to duplicate or create more dashboards. Do you want to upgrade now?
Select a data stream to copy all widgets (optional)

Erreur lors du chargement de la section « Configuration ».
Logs Data Platform is the log management solution by OVH
Index and analyze your logs in real time. Be alerted in case of any issue. Share your logs and analysis with your collaborators.

Logs Data Platform brings you a comprehensive platform to manage and analyze your logs for you or your company. Overlook the behavior of your physicals or virtuals servers. Understand the behavior of your cloud or mobile applications. Predict any incident or be alerted in case of failure.

Logs Data Platform brings you a comprehensive platform to manage and analyze your logs for you or your company. Overlook the behavior of your physicals or virtuals servers. Understand the behavior of your cloud or mobile applications. Predict any incident or be alerted in case of failure.

Logs Data Platform is an interface for collecting, indexing and analyzing logs. Regardless of where they come from, the platform allows you to choose different entry points based on protocol, security level and format. Data analysis and exploitation can be done through different APIs and interfaces.
Your account is disabled on {{disabledDate}}. Contact customer support to enable it.
An alias or an index is required to access the Elasticsearch API.
These tokens allow you to access APIs

If you want to allow access to your logs from external applications or automate some tasks on this basis, you will need to give them access to the APIs. The safest way to manage these access is to use the authentication tokens. With this feature, you no longer need to enter your credentials in your configuration files.
Are you sure you want to delete a token: {{tokenName}} ?
A token {{tokenName}} has been successfully created
A token {{tokenName}} has been successfully deleted
An error has occurred while retrieving tokens: {{message}}
An error has occurred while getting token details: {{message}}
An error has occured while deleting a token {{tokenName}}: {{message}}
An error has occured while creating a token {{tokenName}}: {{message}}
An error has occured while retrieving platform details: {{message}}

The data streams allow you to direct your logs in real time to a specific category as soon as they arrive on Logs Data Platform. If you have multiple streams, you can also: Easily classify messages based on their source, application, or origin server, and create flow-sensitive privacy levels, which will allow you to distribute your access only to authorized persons. The tokens here are write tokens that allow you to route the logs to the correct stream. In general, having different streams greatly facilitates the search for your logs. No need to exclude results from another system or application.
Are you sure you want to delete the data stream: {{stream}} ?
Follow the receipt of your logs in real time via the WebSocket protocol
Archive your logs safely for years
Notify me by e-mail when an archive is available

The archive {{filename}} is unfreezing. It will be available in {{remainingTime}} hours
Once unfrozen, the archives are available to download for 24 hours.

With alert conditions, you don't have to monitor your logs. The platform does it for you. Many use cases are likely to raise an alert and send it to you by e-mail, like: a lack of messages from software for an unusual duration; when the number of tasks performed is abnormally too low; when your website's network traffic is very high; when some specific keywords appear in your feed
Are you sure you want to delete the following alert: {{alert}} ?
An error has occurred while deleting an alert {{alertName}}: {{message}}
The alert {{alertName}} has been successfully deleted.
Alert is triggered when there are {{thresholdType}} than {{threshold}} message(s) in the last {{time}} minute. Include {{backlog}} messages in alert notification.
Alert is triggered when the field {{field}} has {{constraintType}} value {{thresholdType}} than {{threshold}} in the last {{time}} minute. Include {{backlog}} messages in alert notification.
Alert is triggered when messages matching {{field}}:"{{value}}" are received. Include {{backlog}} messages in alert notification.
This condition is triggered when the number of messages is greater than or less than the threshold set in a given period
This condition is triggered when the aggregated value of a field is higher or lower than a defined threshold in a given period of time
This condition is enabled when the value of the field matches the given value
The title of the alert condition
Evaluate the condition for all received messages in the given number of minutes
Select the condition that activates the alert: when there are more or fewer messages than the threshold
Select the condition that activates the alert: when the value is higher or lower than the threshold
The value that activates the alert if the threshold is exceeded
The number of minutes to wait after an alert is resolved to restart another
The number of messages to include in alert notifications
Check this box to send notifications each time the alert condition is met, regardless of its status.
The name of the field to check
The aggregation to apply to the field. This aggregated value is tested for the threshold condition
The value that needs to be compared to that of the field

Collection tools are software for recovering logs from servers or applications. It is an efficient way to process and transform in a GELF compatible format, with Logs Data Platform. No need to dedicate material resources or monitor the availability of your infrastructure, we do it for you. This platform allows you to link these tools to your different streams for a simplified and secure configuration, thanks to firewall rules.
Are you sure you want to delete the following collector tool: {{input}} ?
An error has occurred while deleting a collector tool: {{message}}
The collector tool has been successfully deleted.
Click on the suggested options to copy them to your clipboard
No message received for the last hour.
As long as you do not allow networks, your security is compromised because everyone can access your application
The network {{network}} has been added successfully to input {{inputTitle}}
The network {{network}} has been removed successfully from input {{inputTitle}}
An error has occurred while trying to add network {{network}} to input {{inputTitle}}: {{message}}
An error has occurred while trying to remove network {{network}} from input {{inputTitle}}: {{message}}
Only start one instance of this collector
Number of messages sent by a batch
On this page you can edit input and filter parts of your Logstash configuration file, output section is written by our service. We remind you that you choose to expose TCP port 6514.
Once edited sections you can test the configuration directly.
The delimiter will be "\ n" for each line break.
Null character, typically used by GELF / TCP: \ 0.
Message size prefix as specified in RFC 5425. However, line feeds also act as delimiters, in order to recover corrupted or invalid entries.
This delimiter should only be used for the Cap'n Proto protocol
Number of messages kept in RAM by Flowgger before it sends them to Kafka. A high value is more powerful but may cause indexing latency if you send few messages.
The flowgger configuration has been updated successfully for input {{inputTitle}}

The last test for the configuration was not successful. Please make sure that the configuration is correct and try running the test once again.

Logs Data Platform allows you to create and host Elasticsearch index. These index can be used for the data configuration of a Kibana instance (to store settings, visualizations, and dashboards), to index to static data, or to enrich or correlate your logs. You can use these index with most of the tools and applications compatible with the Elasticsearch REST API.

Activate all possibilities of Elasticsearch by creating an alias on your logs or your indexes. This will give you access to more complex queries like nested aggregations and unlock compatibility with the most popular tools in the ecosystem.

Eleasticsearch indexes are attached to this alias. Either data streams or eleasticsearch indexes can be attached. Remove all eleasticsearch indexes to add data streams.

Your logs contain important information that you sometimes have to share with others. Logs Data Platform allows you to define read-only access rights on part of your streams, dashboards, indices or aliases.

Logs Data Platform is an interface for gathering, indexing and analysing logs. Wherever these logs come from, the platform lets you choose between different entry points depending on the protocol, the security level and the format required. The different APIs and interfaces can be used to analyse and use the data.
Changing the contact address for this service will result in notifications being sent to the new recipient.
Select one of your contacts. If no contact is selected, it will be associated with your main identity by default.

If you want to be able to access your logs from external applications or automate certain tasks on this basis, you have to grant those applications access to your APIs. The most secure way of managing these access rights is by using security tokens. This feature means you will no longer have to enter your username and password in your configuration files.
These tokens will allow you to access the APIs (write in the indices, read Graylog and use Elasticsearch).
You have access to Elasticsearch because you have obtained an index or an alias.
For each data stream, alias and dashboard purchased, you will receive a free user role (e.g. 5 streams purchased = 5 roles).
{{ count }} alias and {{count}} index of {{ size }}

Streams allow you to classify your logs by precise category and in realtime, as soon as they arrive on the Logs Data Platform. If you have several streams, you can also: store messages easily based on their source (the application or server they originated from) and create different degrees of confidentiality for different streams, which means you can grant access to authorised people only. Here, the tokens are write token, which can be used to direct logs to the appropriate flow. Generally speaking, having multiple streams makes it a lot easier to search your logs: you no longer need to exclude the results from another system or another application.
Suivez la réception de vos logs en temps réel via le protocole WebSocket.
Archive your logs securely for years.
Notify me by email when an archive becomes available.
Managing your alerts for the stream {{ name }}

Once you have set up your alerts, you no longer need to monitor your logs - the platform does it for you. Numerous use cases are liable to trigger an alert, which will then be sent to you by email: a lack of messages from a specific piece of software for an unusually long time, if the number of tasks carried out is abnomrnmally low, if traffic on your website is very high or if certain keywords in particular appear in your stream.
This condition is triggered when the number of messages is higher or lower than the defined threshold for a given period.
Evaluate the condition for all messages received within the given number of minutes.
Select the condition that will trigger the alert - more/fewer messages than the threshold.
The value that triggers the alert if it is exceeded.
The number of minutes to wait after an alert has been resolved before reissuing an alert.
The number of messages to include in the alert notifications.
Tick this box to send notifications every time the condition for the alert is met, regardless of the alert's status.
This condition is triggered when the aggregate value for a field is higher or lower than a defined threshold over a given period.
Name of the field to be checked.
Evaluate the condition to be triggered for all messages received within the given number of minutes.
Select the condition that will trigger the alert: when the value is higher/lower than the threshold.
Sélectionner la condition qui active l'alerte : quand la valeur est inférieure ou supérieure au seuil.
The number of minutes to wait after an alert has been resolved before reissuing an alert.
The number of messages to include in the alert notifications.
Tick this box to send notifications every time the condition for the alert is met, regardless of the alert's status.
This condition is activated when the contents of the messages equals a defined value.
Name of the field to be checked.
The value that is to be compared against the field's value.
The number of minutes to wait after an alert has been resolved before reissuing an alert.
The number of messages to include in the alert notifications.
Tick this box to send notifications every time the condition for the alert is met, regardless of the alert's status.
Once archives have been unfrozen, they will be available for download for 24 hours.
The {{ name }} archive is currently being unfrozen. It will be available in {{ time }}.
Confirm deletion of data stream {{ name }}?
Select one of the formats proposed in order to copy the command line required, which will be used to test your stream from a terminal.

Dashboards are graphical representations of your logs. The various modules (curves, pie charts, counters, statistics, etc.) give you an overall summary view of your data. How many errors occurred during the past 24 hours? Is the trend upward or downward? Which was the most visited page today? How many customers this month? All this information and more is at your fingertips. Having several dashboards means you can display data for specific contexts, which makes the information itself easier to interpret.
Attach all modules in the new dashboard to the following data stream:
Confirm deletion of the {{ name }} dashboard?

Gathering tools are software packages used to recover logs from servers or applications. They are an effective of processing and converting logs into GELF format, which is compatible with Logs Data Platform. You no longer have to dedicate material resources to this task or verify that you infrastructures are available - we will do it for you. Thanks to this platform, you can connect these tools to your different streams for a simplified configuration secured via firewall rules.
Click on the options shown to copy them to your clipboard.
Confirm deletion of the {{ name }} gathering tool?
Launch only one instance of this type.
Edit the "input" sections and filter the "output" section of the configuration of your Logstash that we wrote.
As a reminder, you have chosen to open TCP port 6154 publicly.
Once you have edited these sections, you can test your configuration directly.
You can authorise one or more trusted networks via their IP address.
This stage finalises the configuration before you launch your tool.
When there are no authorised networks, your security is compromised, as anyone can access your application.
Would you like to start gathering data now?
Number of messages stored in the RAM by Flowgger before sending them to Kafka. A high value gives better performance but may cause indexing lag if you send only a small number of messages.

Logs Data Platform lets you create and host Elasticsearch indices. These indices can be used for the configuration data of a Kibana instance, indexing your statistical data and enriching or correlating your logs. You can then use these indices with the majority of tools and applications compatible with the Elasticsearch REST API.
Only lower-case letters from a to z, numbers and the characters '-' and '_' are permitted.
N.B.: the option you choose now cannot be changed later.
Edit the information in the {{ name }} index.
Notify me by email when the index reaches critical size.
Confirm deletion of the {{ name }} index?

Tap into the full potential of Elasticsearch by creating an alias on your logs or indices. This will give you access to more complex requests, such as nested aggregations, and will unlock compatibility with the most popular tools on the market.
N.B.: the name you choose now cannot be changed later.
Notify me by email when the index reaches critical size.
Éditer les informations de l'alias {{ name }}.
Notify me by email when the index reaches critical size.
An alias can be attached to one or more Graylog data streams or to one or more Elasticsearch indices.

Your logs contain important information that you sometimes have to share with other people. Logs Data Platform lets you define read-only access rights to the data contained in a selection of your streams, dashboards, indices or aliases.
This is the list of your active members for the {{ name }} role. You can revoke members individually or add new ones by using existing user accounts.
Modify, restrict and/or grant permissions to your roles.
